relations.target: series=05871305-n ((mathematics) the sum of a finite or infinite sequence of expressions);06606007-n (a periodical that appears at scheduled times);06633954-n (a serialized set of programs; \""a comedy series\""; \""the Masterworks concert series\"");07480588-n ((sports) several contests played successively by the same teams; \""the visiting team swept the series\"");08474987-n (similar things placed in order or happening one after another; \""they were investigating a series of bank robberies\"");08475515-n (a group of postage stamps having a common theme or a group of coins or currency selected as a group for study or collection; \""the Post Office issued a series commemorating famous American entertainers\""; \""his coin collection included the complete series of Indian-head pennies\"");13814122-n ((electronics) connection of components in such a manner that current flows first through one and then through the other; \""the voltage divider consisted of a series of fixed resistors\""

programme=00796926-v (arrange a program of or for; \""program the 80th birthday party\"");01751525-v (write a computer program);00552252-n (a performance (or series of performances) at a public presentation; \""the program lasted more than two hours\"");05907175-n (a series of steps to be carried out or goals to be accomplished; \""they drew up a six-step plan\""; \""they discussed plans for a new bond issue\"");05907694-n (a system of projects or services intended to meet a public need; \""he proposed an elaborate program of public works\""; \""working mothers rely on the day care program\"");06581154-n ((computer science) a sequence of instructions that a computer can interpret and execute; \""the program required several hundred lines of code\"");06631935-n (a radio or television show; \""did you see his program last night?\"");06689161-n (an integrated course of academic studies; \""he was admitted to a new program at the university\"");06761180-n (an announcement of the events that will occur as part of a theatrical or sporting event; \""you can't tell the players without a program\""

television=04411547-n (a telecommunication system that transmits images of objects (stationary or moving) between distant points);04413042-n (an electronic device that receives television signals and displays them on a screen; \""the British call a tv set a telly\"");06287933-n (broadcasting visual images of stationary or moving objects; \""she is a star of screen and video\""; \""Television is a medium because it is neither rare nor well done\"" - Ernie Kovacs

senses.definition: A television programme that is not part of a series.
